intro: Krynitzkia racemosa, commonly known as the clustered krynitzkia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Krynitzkia racemosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in dry conditions.
